original_title: Sri Lanka sells Rs145bn Treasury bills
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka has sold 145 billion rupees of Treasury with more than  offered volumes of 3 month bills being sold, data from the state debt office showed.
The debt office sold 85.855 billion rupees of 3-month bills, at 15.29 percent, down 10 basis points after offering 55 billion rupees.
Another 54 billion  rupees of 6-month bills were sold at 14.75 percent, unchanged from last week after offering 60 billion.
Only 5.0 billion rupees of 12-month bills were sold at 12.94 percent, down 02 basis points, after offering 145 billion rupees.
The 6 and 12 month bills are offered in a post-auction window. (Colombo/Nov22/2023)
